Description: Fragment of a basket-handle pottery transport amphora with seemingly high vertical handles; only one handle preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This amphora is now lost. Brief description ('handle of early amphora’) with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund. From the sketch, it is possible to recognise a basket-handle amphora, a popular imported container from Cyprus in the Delta during the Late Period.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.062)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
